ygData.subject: RE: [sg-everquest] RE: Everquesting is over ???
ygData.msgSnippet: Same feeling.  For pple like us who can only login like 2-3 hrs a day, kinda difficult to do big things in EQ (imagine the time spend on taxi-ing everyone
ygData.messageBody:
Same feeling. For pple like us who can only login like 2-3 hrs a day,
kinda difficult to do big things in EQ (imagine the time spend on
"taxi-ing" everyone just to gather for plane raids). I'm looking forward
to Horizon and I've started sending proposal to their development team
giving them feedback and comments (based on my experience with UO, EQ, and
D2).

For those who are interested to find out more abt this coming massive RPG,
u can check this out at:
http://www.artifact-entertainment.com/horizons/horizons.htm
http://horizonsvault.ign.com/
This game is VERY SOLID, and the concept behind the project is very cool.
Imagine 15 races (more than EQ, including vampire, demon, angel and
dragon!!), skill-based (versatile like UO, so u dun get caught in a
specific class when it's nerfed, hehe), 4 times land size of EQ, real 3D
(ie adventure in land, sea and air!!! Not just swiming in EQ but the real
adventure is also found in sea and air!!!), etc etc. Beta out Q1 2001.

For more local online RPGers news, pls subscribe SG-Online-RPRers mailing
list by sending an email to:
SG-Online-RPGers-subscribe@egroups.com
Currently the hottest topics on the mailing is abt the beta test
application for Anarchy Online, a science friction based massive online
RPG. Subscribe to the mailing list for more local news and we will all go
to the same server this time ;)

EQ need to come out with more features (and less frustration). The new UO
development team has already improve UO by alot (not just adding more mobs,
quests or exploring land). With so many new massive online coming up, the
exisitng one must buck up in order to retain their customers.

Zil

p/s: BiBi, time to sell D2 acct liao. I think ya lvl 75 barb can also solo
a 8-men hell game liao, what else is there to keep u? ;P




On Friday, 06 October, 2000 12:00 PM, Alex [SMTP:leealex@...]
wrote:
> This mail is for the EQ old kakis that i know and mainly to Ava Guild to
> "answer" for my "absence"
>
> On-line RPG gaming requires lotsa time. And we "hardcore" seasoned gamer
> since way, way back, knows what it takes to stay committed to our guilds,
> buddies aka kakis. And of course , there is that compelling element (my
> wife calls it pure addiction ) in just having FUN.
>
> EQ has not be very much fun these days.I still love the graphics, Norrath
> etc. But the game is now a bigger "Time-sink " then it was before.
>
> I have intentionally NOT been in EQ for a couple of months now, I dont
know
> if i will be back . I have 3 accounts. Yup crazy bugger i am. Some of u
out
> there have more, U r MAD !
> The 2 accounts will stay with Avan, i have no intention to sell them.
there
> is too much of a "emotion/feeling" tied up in that 1st account. Im a
> oldman, i treasures old memoires . The 3rd floating account will be
> terminated after it expiry in about a month or so.
>
> The Guild has been a fantatic group of people. A very experienced and
> known-famous guild at that too. My umost regrets are mostly on my
> non-participation in Plane raids due to my "curfew" hours.
>
> EQ / verant will be facing extreme competitin next year, which will be
good
> for us gamers.
> recent issue with UORobot developer
> http://www.uorobot.com/eqm_call_to_action.htm ) and UBerYOU
> http://get.to/uberyou/ ) shows the underlining problems of Verant
> attititudes .
>
> I am hoping and wishing that 80 % of the existing EQ gamers will defect
> next year. The game will still be there but verant will hopefully be
> "humbled".
>
> Yours truly,
> Bibi aka Druid Nukem'
> Innoruuk server
>
> Pssst, Zil and Zan, playin BG2 or not? Zan , u MIA from D2 liao?
>
